vistra.framework.graph

Interface ITraversableGraph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TraversableGraph

    public interface ITraversableGraph
    A traversable graph interface. The graph delegates most of its method calls to a constructor-specified Graph.
    • Modifiers are not supported anymore: vertices and edges can neither been added nor removed.
    • In addition, this graph serves with a 'step'-method which an IAlgorithm-developer can use for traversing over the graph and generating a Traversal.
    Author:
    Roland Bruggmann (brugr9@bfh.ch)
    See Also:
    ITraversal

      • getVerticesSorted

        java.util.SortedSet<IVertex> getVerticesSorted()
        Returns a view of all vertices in this graph. The ordering of the vertices within the set is guaranteed to be in alphabetical order of the vertices id.
        Returns:
        a SortedSet view of all vertices in this graph
